frameDefinitions: An Agent (the punisher or rewarder) performs a Response_action on an Evaluee for a Reason, the Evaluee's actions or beliefs.
In this frame, a Communicator judges the Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the Addressee.
An Object with an understood function is or is not in a state ready to perform that function.
A Winner has victory over an Loser.
A Benefactor confers a Beneficial_situation to a Beneficiary.
The words in this frame involve an Undesirable_event which affects the Patient negatively.
frameExamples: His <t>punishment</t> of the prisoners was too harsh.
The principal <t>rebuked</t> the student for cheating on the exam.
His presence at the summit did not <t>BENEFIT</t> diplomatic relations in the slightest.
The first <t>calamity</t> was a disastrous trade war with Holland.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment has made and to whom reward/punishment is dealt. With verbs, the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is typically expressed as Object.
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <fen>Reason</fen> for the <fen>Agent</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a 'for'-PP, e.g.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person doing the rewarding or punishing.
The reward or punishment given to the <fen>Evaluee</fen> by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates a judgment to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> is jduged by the <fen>Communicator</fen> and receives the message of approval or disapproval.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject on which the <fen>Addressee</fen> is being judged.
The <fen>Reason</fen> is why the Communicator forms the type of judgment they form.
The <fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract entity in which the judgment is conveyed.
An action or entity under the control of the <fen>Communicator</fen> that expresses the criticism or praise directed towards the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> berates or compliments the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> admonishes the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The entity with an understood purpose.
The individual or individuals who beat the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The individual or individuals that get beat by the <fen>Winner</fen>.
When the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory <fen>Loser</fen>.
The <fen>Benefactor</fen> is the person or thing that gives an advantage to the <fen>Beneficiary</fen>.
The <fen>Beneficiary</fen> is person or thing that receives an advantage from the <fen>Benefactor</fen>.

The <fen>Beneficial_situation</fen> is the item or action that is given to or done for the <fen>Beneficiary</fen> by the <fen>Benefactor</fen>.  A change of possession can, but does not have to occur.
The undesirable event which occurs.
The entity that experiences the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen>.
When the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> occurs.
Where the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: The boss rewarded <fex>you</fex> for your diligence.
<fex>Jake's</fex> rewards to his best workers were very generous.
If a person be guilty of impiety let him be punished <fex>with death</fex>.
The teacher scolded the children <fex>about their meessy cookie eating</fex>.
The principal rebuked the student <fex>for cheating on the exam</fex>.
Though she had killed him so long ago, she could still see his jeering <fex>smile</fex>.
She complimented me <fex>almost every morning</fex> on my smart starched shirts.
We were scolded <fex>in the kitchen</fex> by the biggest cook you've ever seen.
An <fex>environmental</fex> disaster is just what we need.
